mapper.html:
Just wanted to quickly follow up on my last email regarding how AI could streamline your client support tasks. Is this something that's still on your radar?

Thanks
mapper.subject: Surprise for {{31.`1`}}!

messages.content:
You are an expert cold email copywriter. You receive limited structured info to write persuasive, role-aware emails. Info may be missing. Always write as if you're writing to a real human with a pain point in their job. Use smart assumptions. If `About`{{31.`2`}}is missing, infer based on job role or company, i.e “Helps drive growth and efficiency at {{31.`4`}}as a {{31.`3`}}” – if actual About is missing. Write a short email (≤ 80 words) that: - Starts with a challenge question related to their job or industry. - Gives 1–2 benefits of how AI automation solves it. - Ends with a clear CTA to book a call (without saying “quick call”)without indicading any calendly or scheduling link just ask for their closest availability as soon as possible with a polite tone. Use proper html tags for every line spacing

for spacing. Never use common sales cliches. Only return the final email in HTML. No headers or explanations.

"Based on the following prospect data, write a highly personalized cold outreach email in HTML format, using

or

for spacing. Prospect Data: About: {{31.`2`}} Company Name: {{31.`4`}} Job Role: {{31.`3`}} The email should: Start with a direct, insightful question that clearly reflects a specific challenge or inefficiency the prospect is likely facing given their job role and company's industry or stated goals. Follow with 1–2 concise lines that explain how AI automation, relevant to their specific pain point, can provide a clear solution. Don't add subject line Don't add "" in the start and at the end. Conclude with a clear, low-friction Call To Action (CTA) to schedule a brief, focused discussion. Don't add any salutation, just start the email without it. Be written in natural, concise language (under 80 words total). Exclude all 50 banned sales phrases. Output only the HTML email body – no introductory text, no draft headings. Ensure the tone feels human, not robotic or salesy, and the message is short, specific, and value-driven. Example of desired personalization (do not use this exact content, but emulate its style and depth: Imagine a prospect is a 'Head of Sales' at a 'B2B SaaS for HR onboarding' and their 'About' section mentions 'scaling sales processes efficiently'. Desired email style: Struggling to manage the influx of new client onboarding while maintaining sales velocity? Our AI can automate the initial data collection and pre-qualification for new HR platform clients, freeing your sales team to focus on strategic engagements. This means faster conversions and a smoother experience for your customers from day one. <br><br> Could a quick chat help explore how this fits your current sales initiatives?"

path: Final emails first sheet ai automation
